name: Philip's Home
description: A modest, cramped private residence belonging to Philip Scaletta, filled with stolen goods and personal mementos. The space reflects a life of poverty, paranoia, and petty crime, with cluttered storage and little concern for hospitality or order.

snapshot.name: Philip's Home
snapshot.location: A small, inconspicuous residence in Cassandra, serving as Philip Scaletta’s personal living space
snapshot.description: Philip’s home is cluttered with numerous stolen items—his so-called 'trophies'—carelessly stacked or hidden throughout the room. Despite the mess, certain items are kept with care, including a treasured old family photograph. The atmosphere is tense and defensive, suggesting Philip’s constant fear of being exposed or robbed himself.

characters.name: Philip Scaletta
characters.notes: A small-time thief who values money and survival above all else. He is extremely reluctant to cooperate unless bribed or promised protection from trouble.

clues.clueText: The house is filled with various stolen goods and personal 'trophies' collected by Philip over time.
reveals: Philip’s habitual theft and obsession with keeping his stolen gains

clues.clueText: An old family photograph showing Philip with his parents, carefully preserved.
reveals: Philip once had a happy family life and still harbors emotional attachment to his past

conditions.description: Dim indoor lighting with poorly lit corners

conditions.mechanicalEffect: May impose situational penalties on movement or stealth if a chase or struggle occurs indoors

events: Investigators may confront Philip about his stolen property
Philip may refuse cooperation unless offered money or assistance
snapshot.keeperNotes: Philip is highly protective of his belongings and will react defensively if investigators search his home without permission. Emphasize his greed, fear, and resentment of authority. He may reveal information only when adequately bribed or pressured.
permanentChanges: Stolen items may be confiscated or removed by investigators
Philip’s attitude toward the investigators may permanently worsen or improve depending on their actions

connections.description: Philip’s involvement in the bar incident and his lost knife connect his home to the events at the Reindeer Bar
